name: Toa Payoh Lorong 8 Market & Hawker Centre

reviews.text: Four seasons chendol was the best of the 3 dishes tried, especially if you have a sweet tooth, whatâ€™s not to like about generous gula melaka and coconut milk, chendol was soft, red bean was good, came with two attap chee. Tian Tian carrot cake was average, a little salty and even sweet to me. Changi Village Hokkien mee was average also, the dry type. Wonâ€™t make a trip especially for a the dishes but ok for a normal lunch if happen to be in the area.
It's a very lively area, variety of affordable good foods around. It's quite busy on the weekend, hard to find a table. My first visit and will definitely visit again.

Toa Payoh Lorong 8 Hawker Centre is a fantastic spot with a great variety of affordable food.

I always come here with my parents for the Teochew porridge, fruit juice, popiah, and Hokkien mee! Personally, I prefer the Teochew porridge stall with the orange plates, especially for their braised pork and chicken wings ; very homely and comforting. The other stall, however, offers better steamed fish and braised duck.

Itâ€™s a reliable and satisfying place for good hawker food!
Toa Payoh Lor 8 still have $3/- vegetation dry mee soup

Ordered 3 things from this hawker centre â€¦ they were all good & yummyðŸ˜‹ â€¦ simon road hokkien mee, white char kway teow and good luck bbq chicken wings (chilli was power!)

Huge street-level public parking, very convenient.
